definition.en: The TCCC CUF HC xAPI Profile is scoped to TCCC CUF HC and TCCC ASM content available from the deployed medicine website. It is partially derived from the xAPI Video CoP profile. The profile is designed for programmatic generation of diverse xAPI datasets; datasets which include a multitude of emergent and repeatable patterns of behavior; behavior modeled within this profile as statement templates and patterns.

prefLabel.en: Tactical Combat Casualty Care (TCCC | TC3) Care Under Fire (CUF) Hemorrhage Control (HC) Experience API (xAPI) Profile; aka, TCCC CUF HC xAPI Profile

definition.en: Lifecycle of the Intro Video
return one of the following templates: `:seeked`, `:vol-delta`, `:screen-delta` or `:cc`

prefLabel.en: Intro Video: Any Time After Init But Before Termination

definition.en: Zero or more Video Engagements that can happen regardless of play/pause state.
Things which can, but don't have to, happen to the video after initialization, but prior to termination.
after init, perform zero or more non-play actions potentially followed by a play action

prefLabel.en: Intro Video: After Init Prior Termination

definition.en: Possibly play video + cascading effects
Playing the video, potentially to completion
one pathway ends with a completion, one does not
A sequence of interactions which will terminate with a completion
A sequence of interactions which will not terminate with a completion
Zero or more engagements with the video after play has started prior to video completion

prefLabel.en: Intro Video: After Branch Prior Completion Zero+

definition.en: pause or perform any time video interaction

prefLabel.en: Intro Video: After Branch Prior Completion

definition.en: The pause event and the possible things which can follow
May result in a Played event serving to resume the paused video

description.en-US: Introduction to Hemorrhage Control and Tourniquet application.
Thank you for participating in the TCCC ASM Course! Please take a moment to provide feedback.
The TCCC-ASM Course met the stated learning objectives.
This training motivated me to learn more about TCCC.
The course was presented in a way that helped me stay engaged in the learning process.
The materials I was provided during the course enhanced my learning.
The instructor(s) was(were) knowledgeable and prepared.
I received adequate attention from my skill station instructor(s).
The instructors’ explanations helped me understand the concepts and master these skills.
The presentation(s) was(were) the right length and provided the right amount of information.
The instructional videos helped me learn TCCC concepts and lifesaving skills.
I was given enough time and opportunities to practice each of the TCCC lifesaving skills.
The skills and exercises increased my confidence in delivering lifesaving interventions.
I am confident I can properly place a tourniquet on a casualty.
I am confident that I can pack a wound and apply a pressure bandage and help to slow or stop massive bleeding.
I am confident I can open an airway.
I am confident I can assess a casualty.
I understand how these concepts and skills might apply to real-world situations.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 1

any: The TCCC-ASM Course met the stated learning objectives.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 2

any: This training motivated me to learn more about TCCC.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 3

any: The course was presented in a way that helped me stay engaged in the learning process.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 4

any: The materials I was provided during the course enhanced my learning.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 5

any: The instructor(s) was(were) knowledgeable and prepared.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 6

any: I received adequate attention from my skill station instructor(s).

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 7

any: The instructors’ explanations helped me understand the concepts and master these skills.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 8

any: The presentation(s) was(were) the right length and provided the right amount of information.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 9

any: The instructional videos helped me learn TCCC concepts and lifesaving skills.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 10

any: I was given enough time and opportunities to practice each of the TCCC lifesaving skills.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 11

any: The skills and exercises increased my confidence in delivering lifesaving interventions.

definition.en: when an actor skips Question 12

any: I am confident I can properly place a tourniquet on a casualty.

any: I am confident that I can pack a wound and apply a pressure bandage and help to slow or stop massive bleeding.

definition.en: When a student begins the All Service Members Tactical Combat Casualty Care Student Course Evaluation survey
When a student submits their feedback via the All Service Members Tactical Combat Casualty Care Student Course Evaluation survey
